page.title: 01Leysters and Bockleton
page.content:
A high ridge,the watershed between the Teme and the Lugg, runs through these two parishes. Both are well wooded as a result of extensive tree planting in Leysters in th 19th century and of the management of the large Bockleton estate until recent times.
There are now many small farms in both the parishes, the houses are scattered throughout the area.
The former Bockleton Court is now a Field study centre run by Birmingham education committee.
Both the village schools are now private houses.
